required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Suspected Preeclampsia Based on 6-hour Versus 24-hour Urine Protein Collection
clinical_study.official_title: Management of Pregnancies With Suspected Preeclampsia Based on 6-hour Versus 24-hour Urine Protein Collection - a Randomized Double Blind Controlled Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: In this trial - the investigators plan to study the efficacy of pregnancy management in cases of suspcted preeclampsia, based on a 6-hour urine collection for protein, as compared to the standard 24-hour collection. For participants hospitalized at the maternal fetal unit at our institution, one sample of urine collected over 6 hours will be analyzed, and a second one following an additional 18 hours. Participants will be blinded to the urine collection result used to manage their pregnancy (actual 24 hour collection versus calculated 24-hour collection), as will be their attending physicians. An external physician will compare the two urine collection results, and in case only one is pathological (>300 mg), will notify the research team and the attending physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with an adverse maternal outcome composite
primary_outcome.description: Defined as one of the following maternal complications - hepatic or renal injury, placental abruption, eclampsia, thrombocytopenia, cerebral morbidity, respiratory morbidity, blood pressure > 160/110, need for anti-hypertensives

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants whose neonate had an adverse neonatal outcome composite
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as one of the following neonatal complications - respiratory distress syndrome, necrotizing enterocolitis, mechanichal ventilation, phototherapy, neonatal intensive care unit admission, sepsis, death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single evaluation, up to 18 weeks from recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who underwent a cesarean delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single evaluation, up to 18 weeks from recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who underwent labor induction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single evaluation, up to 18 weeks from recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: Need for labor induction, by mechanichal or pharmaceutical means

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm will collect urine for protein for 6 hours, and then an additional 18 hours. The result of the 6-hour collection will be multiplied by four, and the result will serve as the "calculated collection", for pregnancy management. The additional 18 hour collection will serve for: 1. Patient blinding. 2. Calculation of the total 24-hour protein collection for reference.

Patients in this arm will collect urine for protein for 6 hours, and then an additional 18 hours. The result of the total 24-hour collection will serve for pregnancy management. The initial 6-hour collection will serve for patient blinding.

intervention.description: This intervention includes the analysis of a 6-hour urine collection for protein, to serve for a calculated 24-hour result, according to which pregnancy will be managed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients referred to the Edith Wolfson Medical Center for suspected preeclampsia, for whom hospitalization was recommended for urine collection for protein and blood pressure follow up
- Gestational age >24+0 weeks and < 42+0 weeks
- Consent to participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with features of severe preeclampsia at presentation - blood pressure >160/110, headache, blurred vision, right upper quadrant pain, liver transaminase abnormality, increased creatinine level, thrombocytopenia.
- Patients whom were decided to be delivered (regardless of protein collection)
- Multiple gestation
- Chronic hypertension
- Pre-gestational diabetes mellitus
- Thrombophilia (APLA)
- Intrauterine growth retardation
- Lack of prenatal care

overall_official.affiliation: Obstetrics and Gynecology, Edith Wolfson Medical Center
